channel.title: Cannot access our router :(
channel.description:
Hello. I have a ZyXel P-2602HWT-F3 router. I want to access it but not one of the standard passwords is working. Not admin not 1234, nothing works. I dont know what to do. Is there any way to "hack" the router's password? Noone knows the username or the password. And i dont want to reset it. So if anybody knows how to retrieve the password or hack it in some way, please tell me. Thank you.
Kneistol-

item.title: Cannot access our router :(
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

BloodRayne:

I honestly think it’s a problem with your router, I googled it after I saw your first post and it seems like a lot of people have problems with the password… Resetting might be your only option

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol

@kneistol wrote:

Thank you for the replys.
I will call the company and tell them my story and then see what happens thank you for answering me

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access our router :(
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

OK I’m confused, can you elaborate on it not being your router? Do you not have physical access to it? If it’s a parent’s I don’t see the problem, if it belongs to a neighbour then I’m not sure why we’d want to help you

And I don't have any letter from The ISP...
Alternatively they might have sent you an email with the details, if not then ring like I said. They wont release them over the phone though (unless they have some odd security policies) they'll most likely send out an email or letter.

I probably don’t need to tell you this but your router is your LAN’s gateway to the rest of the internet, bar firewalls its the main defence against network intrusion - there is no easy way of hacking into one. That’s not to say it’s not possible, it certainly is and happens worldwide on a daily basis but still your router as a design feature is made to prevent exactly what you’re trying to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access our router :(
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

One problem… Its not my router… And I don’t have any letter from The ISP…

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access our router :(
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

So you blatantly changed it to something? Reset it, plain and simple.

Find the documents your ISP sent when you first subscribed they probably have the user/pass on, some even have it on the label on the back of the router. If not then just ring your ISP, it’ll take like 2-3 days to send you the details but thats better than guesswork leading nowhere.

EDIT: When you finish backup your router configuration so you don’t need to set it up again in future, but most importantly remember the password.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access our router :(
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

I don’t want to reset it as I will have to set it up again with the server I get the internet from.
I have tried a lot off passwords and usernames. Admin ADMIN admin root ROOT Root 1234 and with all the passwords 1234 root admin Admin ADMIN ROOT Root and a lot of more… The default password has never worked or will be

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access our router :(
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

if the username or password isn’t written on the back of the router itself and you tried ALL possible default username/password combos then your best bet is to reset it

if it helps the default password for some admin accounts is “guest”

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot access our router :(
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Have you tried just entering “Admin” as the user and leaving the password blank? Try alternating between “Admin” and “admin” as username :o

http://forums.pcwintech.com/index.php?topic=2046.0

Might want to read that and see if any of the posts can help you

It looks like this is a common problem for this router

Read full topic
